column4: like people are hoping for drama

column2: yâ€™all! This is @ontologicalprior at @omgcpbigbang bringing you the 2017 Check
column3: Please! Big Bang. In case you arenâ€™t familiar with the term
column4: a Big Bang is a fandom event where authors write fanfic of a certain minimum length and then artists collaborate with them to make art based on their fic. For this Bang
column6: 000 words for authors and 2 pieces of art for artists. All participants will be invited to a chat room on Slack where they can talk
column8: and commiserate with each other. Announcements and deadline reminders will be made on the Slack and using the Tumblr tag #omgcpbigbang. The schedule is as follows:  May 12: Sign-ups open for authors
column11: and pinch-hitters.  June 16: Author sign-ups close.  July 1: First author check-in. Â  August 1: Second author check-in. Fics should be at least 50% completed
column12: with an outline for the rest.  September 1: Fic summaries and drafts are due. Drafts must be at least 80% completed. This is the last day an author can drop out.  September 15: Fic summaries posted. Artist signups close.  September 18: Artist claims open at 12:00 PM Central Standard time. October 6: First artist check-in. Final fics are due and must be 100% completed. October 20: Artist drafts are due. November: Posting begins.   All deadlines are midnight Central Time.  You can sign up as an author
column15: or pinch hitter right here. If you have any questions
column16: please ask at @omgcpbigbang or email omgcpbigbang@gmail.com.Â  " False text

column2: appearing to take senior adviser Kellyanne Conway to task for saying that press secretary Sean Spicer was offering up â€œalternative factsâ€ about the crowd size at the inauguration. â€œA fact is a piece of information presented as having objective reality
column3: â€ the dictionary company said in a pinned tweet that linked to a Merriam-Webster posting about how lookups for the word â€œfactâ€ spiked after Conwayâ€™s comment. Conway
column5: told NBCâ€™s Chuck Todd on Sunday morning that Spicer was offering â€œalternative factsâ€ when he told reporters Saturday night during an impromptu briefing that â€œthis was the largest audience to ever witness an inauguration
column6: period.â€ (Aerial footage and Metro ridership statistics show that attendance was down significantly from President Barack Obamaâ€™s inauguration in 2009.) â€œAlternative facts are not facts
column7: â€ Todd responded. â€œTheyâ€™re falsehoods.â€ Merriam-Webster also noted on Twitter on Sunday that the word â€œfeminismâ€ was getting a lot of attention in the wake of the Womenâ€™s March on Washington on Saturday. â€œ'Feminismâ€™ is our #3 lookup right now. Itâ€™s been trending all day
column8: â€ the company wrote. After someone asked on Twitter why the company is pointing out its No. 3 lookup
column10: Merriam-Webster had a ready comeback: â€œOur #1 lookup is â€˜fascismâ€™
column11: which has been trending consistently for the past few months. We report trends when theyâ€™re new.â€  When you have to remind the fucking president what a fact is.  I love theÂ Merriam-Webster people. " False link

column1: lastknownwriter 151812879077 "2016-10-14 23:23:14 GMT" http://lastknownwriter.com/post/151812879077/click-here-to-support-paulines-medical-treatment "thecausetm:mishasexual:Hello guys
column2: Iâ€™m in an urgent medical treatment as Iâ€™ve been infected by a stray dog I tried to rescue. Full details below! Two weeks ago
column3: my dad and I found and rescued a dog from slaughter in a street on our way home. The men who had the dog bound said that it has been abandoned by its owner. They were going to eat it instead. I convinced them to give me the dog in exchange of a small bag of grocery from the store nearby. So they did and my dad and I came home with the little aspin dog we named Boni. We took him to the vet but all they said was that Boni was so weak and malnourished. We took him home with the very intention of getting him back to normal weight and give him all the love heâ€™s been deprived of. For the first week
column4: his recovery was going on well. He learned to eat without looking up warily to people. He stopped flinching whenever I raise my hand to scratch my face. He stopped whining when I touch him. I couldnâ€™t see his ribs from his skin anymore. He started wagging his tail like a normal dog
column5: instead of just crouching with it between his legs. Everything was fine. I thought he was gonna be okay. Iâ€™m a college student; studying take up so much of my time. When the vet said they couldnt accommodate us the day I went for check-up (it was a public one
column6: they had many patients more demanding of attention) I promised to go back for the vaccines when I got free time. By the next week
column7: I set my appointment to Wednesday of October 12. Boni died Monday
column8: October 10. The Saturday before that I noticed he was eating less. Sunday
column9: I woke up with him frothing in the mouth. I was alone at the house but I took him to the vet anyway. The doctor asked me then
column10: if Boni has bitten anyone. I said no
column11: heâ€™s sweet and introverted. The doctor said that I should have him checked for rabies anyway
column12: but they donâ€™t have laboratories on weekends
column13: so could I go back tomorrow morning? We wake up to him jumping up and falling on his side. He was whining and poop is everywhere. My dad called the pound without me knowing. But he did let me make the decision if I would let Boni be taken down or not. I couldnâ€™t be cruel
column14: not after everything that has happened to him. I was holding him through his last exhales. But the universe really do want to screw me over because yesterday I started manifesting signs of rabies. The doctor told me I may have contracted it through Boniâ€™s saliva which I was wiping off when I brought him to the vet on Sunday. Yesterday morning I started vomiting and being extremely dizzy. By afternoon
column15: my jaws were locking and it was hard to eat. By the time I was writing this
column16: Iâ€™ve just started having fever. Everything happened so miserably fast that I wasnâ€™t financially ready. The full amount of shots would take Php15
column18: but Iâ€™m trying my best to have my national healthcard work for a discount. Now everyone who knows me or follows me on twitter are aware that I love helping strays. I have seven cats and a dog: all of them Iâ€™ve picked up somewhere
column19: somehow. Iâ€™ve been very bitter that Iâ€™m the one to be infected when there are thousands of animal abusers out there. But Iâ€™m starting to come into terms that life doesnâ€™t work the way it should. And I need to get well to help more of the little ones abandoned. Iâ€™ve taken one shot out of five. It was very painful. The doctor said I have category III of rabies. Iâ€™ll be taking four more shots
column20: as well as oral meds. I would return any amount that is excess from the treatment. I promise. (These are my forms: one from the ABC then another from the university) Disclaimer: the dog in the header isnâ€™t Boni. All I have for pics are those of him looking very unhealthy. These was meant to be the â€œbeforeâ€ photos. I didnâ€™t have enough time with him to capture â€œafter.â€ If you want to see those anyway
column21: my email is npaununez@gmail.com TL;DR - Please read it and see the photo docs. I would feel cheap (well I supposed I am but still) to receive donations if you didnâ€™t know what exactly happened.pls guys pauline needs ur help and i cant think of anyone who deserves it more" False link
